NodeFirstChild.summary:
The read-only firstChild property of the interface
returns the node's first child in the tree,
or null if the node has no children.

remarks.para:
If the node is a ,
this property returns the first node in the list of its direct children.

blockquote.para:
Note: This property returns any type of node that is the first child of this one.
It may be a or a node.
If you want to get the first that is a child of another element,
consider using .

NodeFirstChild.value: A , or null if there are none.
